hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Momentum Threshold on Policy News Clarity
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime and a major regulatory clarity event occurs (e.g., MiCA detail publication, FCA framework), a concurrent breakout above the 20-day high on a >15% increase in volume vs 20-day average will signal a high-probability transition to a BULL regime, favoring a long entry.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes are often held in check by uncertainty. A concrete regulatory development removes a systemic overhang. A high-volume breakout confirms institutional and large trader commitment, providing the momentum thrust needed to transition to a sustained BULL regime.
entry_conditions: Major regulatory clarity headline occurs (categorized by FjordHQ news sentiment > 0.5)
On the same or next trading day, BTC price breaks above its 20-day high
Volume on breakout day > 115% of 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price retraces > 75% of the breakout day's range and closes below the 20-day high
exit_conditions.time_exit: 3 days without a BULL regime confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of such high-volume breakouts following positive news fail to lead to a BULL regime within 3 days, indicating the news is 'priced in' or insufficient.
